intro: Luma pallida, commonly known as the pale luma, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pale pink to white flowers and hairy, ovate leaves. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
